cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 172 (Thursday, October 19, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GARAMENDI:H.R. 5991.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 and Article IV, Section 3,Clause 2 of the the U.S. ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To require the Commandant of the Coast Guard and theCommissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to makecertain determinations in enforcing the Jones Act, and forother purposes.[Page H5032]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee
Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E996)

bill.title: Close Agency Loopholes to the Jones Act of 2023

item.title: Close Agency Loopholes to the Jones Act of 2023
Close Agency Loopholes to the Jones Act of 2023
To require the Commandant of the Coast Guard and the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to make certain determinations in enforcing the Jones Act, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
